metadata.title: CVE-2019-20043 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In in wp-includes/rest-api/endpoints/class-wp-rest-posts-controller.php in WordPress 3.7 to 5.3.0, authenticated users who do not have the rights to publish a post are able to mark posts as sticky or unsticky via the REST API. For example, the contributor role does not have such rights, but this allowed them to bypass that. This has been patched in WordPress 5.3.1, along with all the previous WordPress versions from 3.7 to 5.3 via a minor release.

criterions.comment: wordpress package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.2+dfsg1-1').
